p: Each feature had to meet specific conditions to be assigned a resilience value of 1 for high resilience, 2 for moderate resilience and 3 for low resilience ( Table 3). The planning unit grid file was overlaid with each resilience feature layer to create six GIS layers with a resilience value for each 1 km 2 planning unit. Any planning units that fell outside the extent of the resilience feature datasets were assigned a score of 1 (high resilience) as they all occurred in deeper water (>20 m) [ 19].
